question: According to the World Bank, which countries had gross savings of over 35% of GDP for every year in the period 2001-2010? Give your answer as a comma-separated list of countries in alphabetical order. Use the countries most common names in english when answering.

args.code:
import requests, json
import sys

url = 'https://api.worldbank.org/v2/country/all/indicator/NY.GNS.ICTR.ZS?date=2001:2010&format=json&per_page=20000'
resp = requests.get(url, timeout=30)
print(resp.status_code)
print(len(resp.text))
print(resp.text[:3000])

trajectory.actor_reasoning: I need to programmatically query the World Bank API for gross savings (% of GDP) for all countries from 2001 to 2010 and filter those with values above 35 every year.

args.code:
import json, sys, urllib.request

# Fetch country list to filter out aggregates
countries_url = 'https://api.worldbank.org/v2/country?format=json&per_page=400'
with urllib.request.urlopen(countries_url, timeout=30) as resp:
    countries_data = json.loads(resp.read().decode('utf-8'))

# Build maps
country_list = countries_data[1]
iso_to_name = {}
valid_iso3 = set()
for c in country_list:
    # Exclude aggregates
    if c.get('region', {}).get('value') != 'Aggregates':
        iso_to_name[c['id']] = c['name']
        valid_iso3.add(c['id'])

# Fetch indicator data for 2001-2010
indicator_url = 'https://api.worldbank.org/v2/country/all/indicator/NY.GNS.ICTR.ZS?date=2001:2010&format=json&per_page=20000'
with urllib.request.urlopen(indicator_url, timeout=60) as resp:
    ind_data = json.loads(resp.read().decode('utf-8'))

entries = ind_data[1]

# Collect values per iso3 per year
from collections import defaultdict
vals = defaultdict(dict)

for e in entries:
    iso3 = e.get('countryiso3code')
    if not iso3 or iso3 not in valid_iso3:
        continue
    year = e.get('date')
    val = e.get('value')
    if year is None:
        continue
    # Keep as float if present
    if val is not None:
        vals[iso3][int(year)] = float(val)

qualified = []
for iso3, yearvals in vals.items():
    years = list(range(2001, 2011))
    if all((y in yearvals and yearvals[y] > 35.0) for y in years):
        qualified.append(iso3)

# Map to names and sort by common English names; attempt minimal normalization
names = [iso_to_name[i] for i in qualified]

# Simple normalization mapping for common English names
normalize = {
    'Hong Kong SAR, China': 'Hong Kong',
    'Macao SAR, China': 'Macao',
    'Congo, Dem. Rep.': 'Democratic Republic of the Congo',
    'Congo, Rep.': 'Republic of the Congo',
    'Gambia, The': 'The Gambia',
    'Bahamas, The': 'The Bahamas',
    'Brunei Darussalam': 'Brunei',
    'Egypt, Arab Rep.': 'Egypt',
    'Iran, Islamic Rep.': 'Iran',
    'Kyrgyz Republic': 'Kyrgyzstan',
    'Korea, Rep.': 'South Korea',
    'Korea, Dem. People’s Rep.': 'North Korea',
    'Lao PDR': 'Laos',
    'Syrian Arab Republic': 'Syria',
    'Venezuela, RB': 'Venezuela',
    'Yemen, Rep.': 'Yemen',
    'Cabo Verde': 'Cape Verde',
    'Myanmar': 'Myanmar',
    'Russian Federation': 'Russia',
    'Türkiye': 'Turkey',
}

names_norm = [normalize.get(n, n) for n in names]

for_print = sorted(set(names_norm))
print('\n'.join(for_print))

trajectory.actor_reasoning: I need to fetch the World Bank API JSON for all countries and for the indicator NY.GNS.ICTR.ZS for 2001-2010, then programmatically filter countries where each year exceeds 35 and exclude aggregates.

args.code:
import requests, json

# Fetch country metadata to filter real countries
cmeta = requests.get('http://api.worldbank.org/v2/country?format=json&per_page=400')
print(cmeta.status_code)
cm = cmeta.json()
entries = cm[1]
real = {}
for c in entries:
    # Exclude aggregates
    if c.get('region', {}).get('value') != 'Aggregates':
        real[c['id']] = c['name']

# Fetch indicator data for 2001-2010
url = 'http://api.worldbank.org/v2/country/all/indicator/NY.GNS.ICTR.ZS?date=2001:2010&format=json&per_page=20000'
resp = requests.get(url)
print(resp.status_code)
js = resp.json()
print(len(json.dumps(js)))
meta, data = js

# Collect values by iso3 and year
from collections import defaultdict
vals = defaultdict(dict)
for item in data:
    iso3 = item.get('countryiso3code')
    year = item.get('date')
    val = item.get('value')
    if iso3 in real and year is not None:
        vals[iso3][int(year)] = val

# Determine set of years
years = list(range(2001, 2011))

ok = []
for iso3, ymap in vals.items():
    good = True
    for y in years:
        v = ymap.get(y)
        if v is None or not (v > 35):
            good = False
            break
    if good:
        ok.append(real[iso3])

ok_sorted = sorted(ok)
print(len(ok_sorted))
print(ok_sorted[:50])
print(ok_sorted[50:100])
print(ok_sorted[100:])

trajectory.actor_reasoning:
Using the World Bank WDI indicator NY.GNS.ICTR.ZS for 2001-2010 and filtering for countries above 35 each year (excluding aggregates), the qualifying countries are:

FINAL ANSWER: Brunei, China, Morocco, Singapore
